newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS crude, products prices steady.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS crude, products prices steady.

text.p: U.S. crude oil and refined products prices were steady in early ACCESS trade after tumbling through a correction in the earlier floor session on Tuesday, traders said.
Traders after-hours appeared to be catching their collective breath and waiting for the weekly American Petroleum Institute stocks estimates to assess their next move, traders said.
"I think everyone is kind of sitting back," one trader said of the mood in the after-hours session. "People are looking for direction on the API's coming out."

The NYMEX oil complex on Tuesday moved lower after a surge in speculative positions taken out in recent weeks left the market long on crude oil as trade resumed following the three-day holiday weekend.
July crude oil was bid $20.79 a barrel with 258 front-month lots traded, unchanged after closing down 84 cents a barrel in the floor session.

July heating oil was bid 55.25 cents a gallon, rebounding slightly after closing down 2.26 cents at 55.22 cents a gallon. There were 329 lots traded, including 36 in the front-month contract, traders said.
July gasoline was bid 63 cents a gallon, unchanged after settling off 1.90 cents a gallon on the day. Trade was thin, with 168 lots traded early in the session.
